data.title: NATO Alphabet
data.statement:
To avoid confusion when verbally spelling a name, people sometimes use the word in the NATO alphabet associated with each letter in the name.

Help these people speak the spelling of their names.

~~~~~~

The NATO alphabet is {{Alpha, Bravo, Charlie, Delta, Echo, Foxtrot, Golf, Hotel, India, Juliett, Kilo, Lima, Mike, November, Oscar, Papa, Quebec, Romeo, Sierra, Tango, Uniform, Victor, Whiskey, X-ray, Yankee, Zulu}}

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testOut: Alpha Uniform Bravo Romeo Echo Echo

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testOut: Golf Yankee Lima Lima Echo November Hotel Alpha Alpha Lima

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testOut: Golf India Uniform Delta India Charlie Echo

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testOut: Hotel Echo Romeo Mike India Oscar November Echo

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testOut: Delta Echo Lima Echo Victor India November Golf November Echo

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testOut: Alpha Zulu Alpha Romeo India Alpha Hotel

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testOut: X-ray India Mike Echo November Alpha

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testOut: Kilo Echo India Bravo Lima Echo Romeo

testCases.title: Test 6
testCases.testOut: Delta Alpha Sierra Hotel India Echo Lima Lima

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testOut: Juliett Oscar Hotel Alpha November Sierra Sierra Oscar November

data.stubGenerator:
read Name:string(16)
write Alpha, Bravo, Charlie, Delta, Echo, Foxtrot, Golf, Hotel, India, Juliett, Kilo, Lima, Mike, November, Oscar, Papa, Quebec, Romeo, Sierra, Tango, Uniform, Victor, Whiskey, X-ray, Yankee, Zulu
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> That [[name]] spelled out using the NATO alphabet

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

To avoid confusion when verbally spelling a name, people sometimes use the word in the NATO alphabet associated with each letter in the name.

Help these people speak the spelling of their names.

~~~~~~

The NATO alphabet is Alpha, Bravo, Charlie, Delta, Echo, Foxtrot, Golf, Hotel, India, Juliett, Kilo, Lima, Mike, November, Oscar, Papa, Quebec, Romeo, Sierra, Tango, Uniform, Victor, Whiskey, X-ray, Yankee, Zulu
Input
Line 1: A string name
Output
Line 1: That name spelled out using the NATO alphabet
Constraints
name consists only of letters
Example
Input
Lisa
Output
Lima India Sierra Alpha
